snippet: The United States is expected to reach its $16.4 trillion debt ceiling at the end of December, starting a countdown to when Washington runs out of money to pay its bills.
abstract: Government is within days of hitting its legal borrowing limit, complicating already fraught fiscal negotiations between White House and Congressional Republicans; United States is expected to reach its $16.4 trillion debt ceiling at the end of December, starting a countdown to when Washington runs out of money to pay its bills.
lead_paragraph: The United States is expected to reach its $16.4 trillion debt ceiling at the end of December, starting a countdown to when Washington runs out of money to pay its bills.

headline.seo: On Capitol Hill, Fiscal Talks Now Turn to U.S. Borrowing Limit
headline.main: On Capitol Hill, Fiscal Talks Now Turn to U.S. Borrowing Limit
headline.print_headline: On Capitol Hill, Fiscal Talks Now Turn to U.S. Borrowing Limit
